title: family stuck flat damp mouldy
story: Family stuck in flat so damp and mouldy wet ceiling flakes onto their dinner platesBrian Gerson says his we Kellymarie Gerson and their four kids are living in unliveable conditions at the two-bedroom property in South East London for more than  yearsThis family say they are living like crabs in a barrel as they suffer from health conditions in a mouldy, cramped flat Image: Brian GersonByMonica CharsleyNews ReporterAlahna KindredNews Reporter:,  Jan | commentsA family who are stuck in an overcrowded flat riddled with mould say they have been left to live in disgusting conditions that sees ceiling flakes pepper their dinner plates. Brian Gerson says his we Kellymarie Gerson and their four kids have been forced to deal with the unliveable conditions at the two-bedroom property in South East London which they compare to being like crabs in a barrel. The dad has become increasingly worried about his familyaposs health. He claims that the majority of his family have developed respiratory issues because of the thick damp that has plagued the property, which is under Optivo Housing Association.He further claims the conditions are so poor that his family are forced to pick pieces of their wet ceiling out of their food because of the paint crumbling, the Daily Star reports.  Brian also said their living situation has caused him to move out and live with his mum. The dad told the Daily Star: It has been over  years my we has had to deal with it - she first moved in with her firstborn daughter in . The mould has also brought problems such as things being ruined [such as] clothes, toys, furniture and keepsakes, so they have to be thrown away. The ceiling also flakes off bits of paint that end up everywhere from in the bath, to falling into your food while cooking.  He said his weaposs eldest child was diagnosed with asthma within the first two years of moving in and that their other childaposs health is also poor. Brian added: Her firstborn son was born premature and had to be incubated for the first two months of his le and ended up having subglottic stenosis [an issue with a childaposs airways just below their vocal cords]. This is classed as a disability since he has trouble regulating his breathing while running and playing - it has been made worse by the mould. The dad said: The pandemic also has taken its toll on the family seeing as itaposs like crabs in a barrel [with] nowhere to escape to.  With the eldest being fteen years of age, you can imagine how it [must be for her] to share a room with her younger siblings that are nine and three years old. He says that the most recent medical evidence submitted to the housing association by his we has been disregarded. Brian claims: Optivo have done the bare minimum to try and solve anything. It needs more than just a mould wash. They have also painted over the mould rather than treating it properly [and] have misplaced records of complaints and jobs that they have done in the property.  They seem to be trying to do everything possible to keep her and the kids in that property because they know that they would have a hard time getting someone to take it. They need to be named and shamed for treating them like this and I can [only] imagine how many other households have been affected by the same housing association. Optivo said in a statement: We were made aware of mould and damp in one of our homes in Brockley on  November , when reported by our resident, Ms. Gerson. We carried out an inspection on  December . We found low-level mould in rooms including the kitchen, bathroom and living space. As a result of the inspection, we’ll be attending the home on  January to complete a mould wash treatment of affected areas. This treatment is designed to kill and inhibit the growth of mould, fungi and mildew. We’ve also agreed a date of  February to redecorate the treated areas, which is the first date Ms Gerson is available.  We’ll also install a fan on  January to increase ventilation and help to stop mould growth. If Ms Gerson is looking to find a new home, she’ll need to discuss this with her local authority, who are responsible for the allocation of homes. Our Lettings Team are here to support with this process, but the decision to accept the move remains with the local authority. A member of our housing team will make contact with Ms Gerson next week to discuss options available to her. We have a record of one complaint, raised by Ms. Gerson on  November . We worked to resolve this and responded on  November  with an action plan. The complaint has since been closed due to receiving no further response from Ms. Gerson. We’ve no record of any further or misplaced complaints. We’re sorryMs. Gerson feels we’ve not met her expectations, and we’re working with her to further address the issues she’s raised. title: haunting figure mum pram stops
story: The haunting figure of mum and pram that stops traffic at food truck near busy motorwayTruck drivers have pulled over to have their photos taken with the eerie figure and the council even came out, fearing for her safety onceBetty Bypass has become something of a local myth in the areaByAlison BrinkworthKieren WilliamsNews Reporter:,  Jan | comments The figure of a mum hunched over her pram regularly draws the interest of drivers near a busy motorway and has earned the name ‘Betty Bypass’.The eerie character has become a local legend in her haunt on the Birmingham Worcestershire border.Motorists often keep an eye out for her and lorry drivers have been known to stop for a photo along their travels on the M. Council officials have even headed out to find her with concerns for her safety, Birmingham Live reports.But ‘Betty Bypass’ never travels far and stays at her favourite spot in the shadow of Nick’s Sandwich Bar, a food van on the A between Rubery and Bromsgrove, near Junction  of the M. It’s been around  years since she first appeared at the roadside with her ghost-like features and nose peeling from her age.  Food van owner Nick Husband, , from Rubery, has grown attached to the strange figure over the years. He said: aposBetty Bypassapos gets a lot of attention around these parts and is seen in all sorts of places from the road with her pram. Sheaposs been around for about  years and hopefully with me for a long time to come as Betty is like family.  But the beginnings of this eerie tale start with practical joker Nick, who bought aposBettyapos the mannequin from the PDSA charity shop in Rubery High Street so he could pose her in dferent positions with a pram next to the food van. I get someone asking me every day about Betty, chuckled Nick. Some think sheaposs real, many take their photos with her and others worry about her being homeless and want to help her. A few years ago, a council officer came down saying it was on the agenda to discuss her at the next meeting as councillors had raised concerns about aposthe ladyapos. The Mirroraposs newsletter brings you the latest news, exciting showbiz and TV stories, sport updates and essential political information.The newsletter is emailed out first thing every morning, at noon and every evening. Never miss a moment by signing up to our newsletter here.  I said, aposgo and take this drink over to herapos and he couldnapost believe it when he realised she was a mannequin. aposOh no!apos he said aposthe report is all done for a council discussion now!apos I took the pram away for a while and people kept asking me aposWhereaposs the baby gone apos, we just told them itaposs grown up and gone to school. Nick, who sponsors Cofton Athletic Football Club and donates food to the homeless in Birmingham city centre regularly, also poses aposBettyapos up for special occasions, such as with Champagne for the New Year.  As soon as I saw Betty in the charity shop, I knew I wanted her, added Nick. She cost me £ but itaposs the best £ I ever spent. Nickaposs colleague and best friend Sue OaposLeary, , who used to run tearoom Polly Put The Kettle On in Rubery, said Betty provides a lot of entertainment for the pair and their regulars, who include staff from across the emergency services. Nick is a practical joker and has come up with all sorts of things around Betty, added Sue.  Heaposs had taxi drivers buying burgers here and told them sheaposs been waiting hours for a cab, just to see what happens when they go over. Betty has just become a familiar face to our regulars. We get a lot of police officers, ambulance staff and carers visiting us here as they are on the road all day. No celebrities yet although we have had royalty go past when Prince Charles and Camilla were in the area. They didnapost stop but I wonderthey spotted Betty too. A local tree surgeon for the area has also joined in the fun by adding toy monkeys high up in the trees near Betty for visitors to spot too. title: i made redundant went labour
story: I was made redundant as I went into labour with twins - then I lost everything in fire and floodSingle mum-of-three Carly Breslin, , was made redundant from her job of  years as she went into labour with her twins - but her bad luck continued when her flat in Islington, north London flooded and then caught on fire on Christmas EveSingle mum-of-three Carly Breslin, , was made redundant as she went into labour with twins Image: Carly Breslin   SWNSByGeorgia LambertRyan FaheyNews Reporter:,  Jan | comments A mum made redundant as she went into labour with twins became homeless when her flat flooded - then lost all her belongings in a house fire. When single mum-of-three Carly Breslin was made redundant from her job of  years as she went into labour with twins, she thought that thing couldnapost get any worse.But seven months later as she cared for her five children her family had to be rehoused in a hotel when her flat flooded following heavy rain, leaving them homeless. What she could salvage she stored in a dferent part of the property away from the water damage, along with her kidsapos Christmas presents.But as the family waited to be rehoused from the two rooms of their hotel, their old flat caught fire on Christmas Eve, destroying the little they had left along with the presents.When reliving her ordeal, the -year-old said: I canapost tell you how stressed Iaposve been - too much has happened that I canapost begin to make sense of it all, itaposs just been terrible.Carly and her kids aged , seven, three and newborn lived on the top floor of a new build in Islington north London until the extreme weather turned their lives upside down. The former art director for Toni and Guy, said: In July, we had the flash floods and there must have been a lot of rain which was just building up on the roof. It started off trickling down one of the light fittings and it took about three weeks for it to be pouring out of everywhere. We were told by surveyors that it was unsafe to live there anymore, so the council put us in a hotel and at first I was like aposoh my god, I canapost live like that, I have babies to look afterapos and at that time I thought even a night would be too much. But weaposve been there for six months now.  While waiting to be rehoused, Carly and her five children have been living in two rooms at the hotel in Angel, just a mile away from their family home. Her mum Tracie, who chose to set up a heartfelt GoFundMe page to help her daughter face the financial burden, said: As you can imagine, living in hotel rooms with a -year-old, seven-year-old, a three-year-old, and seven-month-old twins has been very challenging. With the hope of keeping the festive spirit alive in the run-up to Christmas, Carly was looking forward to spending the day with her family. However, come Christmas Eve morning at around  am a fire broke out and ripped through what was left of the family home.  As Carly recalled: It was around  am on Christmas morning when I woke up to lots of missed calls from two of my old neighbours who told me the flat was on fire and I just couldnapost believe it. Everyone had been evacuated but we just couldnapost work out what had caught alight. From the flooding, there was mould growing on what was left of the furniture, so we had put everything we couldaposve saved in boxes in the kitchen and the living room, where it was safe, but thataposs where the fire happened. Because my kids still believe in Santa, I decided to hide their presents in the flat because I wanted them to be surprised and have a nice day. The presents had been ruined by the fire, and of the ones we managed to save, they smelt of smoke and were covered in black soot. My little girl said that aposFather Christmas had gone down lots of chimneysapos because she could smell the smoke, so I went with that story because I didnapost want to worry them.  Carly explained that she decided to try and make the best out of the worst situation but is worried about how she might come across. She said: I was so overwhelmed at what had happened and itaposs so upsetting to see all your stuff ruined. Any other day wouldaposve been easier for me to handle, but it was Christmas and all I wanted was for them to have a nice day after going through so much upset, so making it special was quite important for me. Iaposve tried to keep things away from them as much as possible and they did end up really enjoying the day, despite what happened. I had to go away to wipe my tears and come back pretending I was okay. I donapost want to be seen as some sort of charity case but we did lose everything and my mum set up the fundraising page to help us rebuild the things we lost. The family is still unsure what caused the fire and is waiting for an investigation to take place.Writing on the GoFundMe page, Tracie said: Carly was devasted when she saw the damage to everything she owned,it wasn’t burnt or melted it had smoke damage.Many have suggested to set this page up which at first we didn’t want to do butwe could at least try and get a little bit of help it would go a long way for Carly and the children. They have been through so much this year they deserve a little help. So, I am asking youyou could help restore my daughteraposs broken heart. We are all so grateful for all your support at this unbearable time. All your messages have meant so much and have filled our hearts! title: last selfie teenager who vanished
story: Last selfie of teenager who vanished into thin air after leaving nightclub at amPolice have launched a desperate search after Marnie Clayton, , vanished after leaving a nightclubMarnie Clayton was last seen leaving Atik nightclub in Windsor Image: Thames Valley Police   SWNSByKieren WilliamsNews Reporter:,  Jan | comments The last selfie of a teenager who vanished into thin air has been released as police launch a desperate appeal to get her home. Marnie Clayton was last seen leaving Atik nightclub in Windsor, around am this morning.However, she never ed home and was reported missing by her family just before am. Police have launched an urgent bid to try and find her and released her selfie. Marnie has been described as white, around ft ins to ft ins tall, with brown hair and a slim build. The selfie was taken only hours before she vanished from Windsor.  It shows the teenager happy and smiling in grey dress, shortly before she went out for her night clubbing. Police said that they are growing “increasingly concerned for her welfare” and that the disappearance is “out of character”. She is known to frequent Reading town centre.Detective Chief Inspector Jon Groenen of Thames Valley Police, said: “This is out of character for Marnie, and we are becoming increasingly concerned for her welfare.  “I would appeal to anybody who knows of Marnie’s whereabouts to please call us on , quoting reference number . “If you see her, please contact us on . “I would also like to appeal directly to Marnie,you see this appeal, please contact your family or the police to let us know you are safe and where you are.” Read MoreRead MoreMost Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON Thames Valley PoliceTeenagersSelfiesMissing persons" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get email updates with the days biggest storiesInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: mum bursts tears after finding
story: Mum bursts into tears after finding preserved wedding dress has turned stale yellowMum-of-two Sarah Casson, , from Sutton Coldfield in the West Midlands, had dreams of passing the near£, Swarovski crystal-encrusted wedding dress on to her daughtersshe hadnt had two boysMum-of-two Sarah Casson, , says she had the dress preserved for the future at a local dry cleaners nearly  years ago Image: Birmingham LiveByEmily CollisRyan FaheyNews Reporter:,  Jan | comments A mum-of-two burst into tears after finding her brilliant white wedding dress has turned a stale yellow despite having spent hundreds of pounds to preserve it. Sarah Casson, , had dreams of passing down her bridal gown to her children, or to wear it for her th anniversary of being wed to husband Kevin. But Sarah says she was shocked to tears when she opened the dry cleaneraposs box for the first time since they tied the knot  years ago, Birmingham Live reports.She opened the lid to find her beautul and bespoke Swarovski crystal-encrusted silk bodice had turned a stale shade of yellow. Sarah, from Sutton Coldfield in the West Midlands, said the dress is very sentimental to me and sheaposd hoped to pass it on to her daughtersshe hadnapost had two boys. The dress isnapost something her daughter-in-laws would wear, so she planned to flog it and get something you [I] always wanted. The telecommunications client partner told Birmingham Live: Weaposre moving house so I thought Iaposll get it down from on top of the wardrobe and maybe I could sell it.  The dress is very sentimental to me. When I got married I thought I might have a daughter one day I can pass it on to or change it into a christening gown for a grandchild. But Iaposve got two sons and itaposs not something their partners would wear so my husband said why not sell it and use the money to get something youaposve always wanted. But that was why I had the preserving treatment. You pay to have it treated in a special way and wrapped in acid-free paper so in the years to come, it looks as good as new and you can pass it on. I havenapost looked at it once all these years. I thoughtI open the box, it could ruin the preservation on it.  But I opened it before Christmas and I burst into tears. The net still looks white but the bodice was yellow. Three years after their marriage in , Sarah took the pricey £, gown to a dry cleaners. Sarah recalled forking between £ to £ for the preservation treatment, but says she has lost the receipt in the many years since. When I saw the dress, I took it straight back to the dry cleaners, said Sarah. They told me that because it had been treated all that time ago, there was nothing they could do.  It wasnapost like I paid a couple of pounds to have it cleaned, I paid hundreds of pounds to preserve it. Whataposs so frustrating is Iaposve still got the veil I wore on my wedding day that I never got cleaned which is still brilliant white. My original plan was to maybe re-wear the dresswe renewed our vows for our th anniversary. Iaposm quite into my fitness so I could have worn it again, but now I donapost have that option because who wants to wear a yellow wedding dress  The dress is still in its original box, which is still in good condition, she says. A spokesperson for the dry cleaners in question told BirminghamLive: There were no identying tags on the dress to confirm it was us that did the preservation  years ago.  We package all of our wedding dresses in acid-free tissue and in an acid-free box to ensure that this doesnapost affect the colour of it, but it does require to be kept in a reasonable, stable temperature. It canapost be kept in the loft or anywhere with damp or severe changes in temperature as that can affect the preservation. When this dress was ed to us, it did not have acid-free tissue wrapped around it in the same way we package our wedding dresses and the box did look as though it had been knocked about a bit, with damp patches and water marks over it. They added: [The discolouration] will be down to the way it has been stored. title: mum diagnosed condition shes childhood
story: Mum diagnosed with condition shes had since childhood after routine GP appointmentSarah ORourke, , was sitting with her GP when she said she had to go home to unplug all the wires in her house because she believes someone was taking pictures of her - she had become convinced she was going to be a victim of revenge pornSarah ORourke was diagnosed with bipolar after going to her GP - she had become convinced she was going to be a victim of revenge porn Image: Sarah ORourkeBySophie Halle-RichardsAlahna KindredNews Reporter:,  Jan | comments A mum was diagnosed with bipolar following a routine GP appointment years after noticing symptoms during her childhood.Sarah OaposRourke, , was sitting with her GP when she said she had to go home to unplug all the wires in her house because she believes someone was taking pictures of her.In the months leading up to the appointment, the then -year-old had been increasingly having delusional thoughts, Manchester Evening News reports. The mum-of-two was convinced she was going to be a victim of revenge porn and believed someone had set up cameras in her house.Sarah, from Wythenshawe, would take apart all of her electrical devices because she was terried someone was going to upload an indecent video of her to Netflix. On another occasion, Sarah phoned her dad and told him to go into her loft as she was convinced she could hear people talking. Sarah also phoned the police on several occasions as she thought she could hear people whispering at the side of her house. She said: I knew they thought I was crazy. Sarah was referred to a psychiatrist and social worker and was eventually diagnosed with bipolar disorder three years ago.She has since set up a blog called Sarah OaposRourke Bipolar and Me and aims to challenge some of the stigma surrounding the condition. Sarah said: I always felt dferent but this became more apparent when I was around eight-years-old. I found building relationships dficult because I could see and feel that people were dferent to me. But as I got a little older I excused this by acknowledging my parents had separated and this may have something to do with why I felt the way I did. I was overwhelmed with sadness and loneliness and thinking about it now it is really unfortunate to feel those things at that age and it upsets me that I felt that way. Sarah recalls her teenage years consisted of smoking and drinking and at the age of , claims she was sexually exploited. She attended college and worked ious jobs, eventually landing her dream job as a special needs teaching assistant. But her manic episodes and depression continued to spiral out of control, meaning she had to leave her job to focus on her health. She said: I had been doing things that in my normal mindset I wouldnapost do. Iaposd take big risks and date men that I knew I shouldnapost. One day I was really upset and the next day you couldnapost shut me up. I was all over the place. Following her bipolar diagnosis, Sarah was taken off antidepressants and prescribed antipsychotic medication for the first time. She said: Now I have ups and downs but they are not as bad as they were. When I talk about the depression I had before I was suicidal. I still can’t really plan anything because I don’t know how I am going to feel when I wake up. Sarah says her diagnosis has inspired her to channel all the negative things that happened to her and begin a new chapter. She said: The blog is something I can do at my own pace but is informative and can help other people. The lack of understanding about bipolar even with my own friends and family has been terrible. Sarah hopes to be able to use the blog to show people what itaposs like to live with bipolar day-to-day and raise awareness of the signs and symptoms of the condition. She said: I do wish I had been diagnosed sooner. I went to see the GP purely by chance. She added: I am putting my story out there to make people think about the way they are. It might even make some people seek help for their own behaviour. title: postie manages deliver letter addressed
story: Postie manages to deliver letter addressed to ‘somewhere in the Yorkshire Dales’A man was surprised when he received a letter that didnt even have his address on it, as the sender had written somewhere in the Yorkshire Dales alongside a rambling descriptionMark Dale received a letter that didnt even have his address on it Image: Ben Lack Photography LtdByJohn BettAudience Writer:,  Jan | comments A postie managed to successfully deliver a letter that was addressed to apossomewhere in the Yorkshire Dalesapos.Mark Dale had heard a recent story about Royal Mail managing to successfully deliver a letter that had no address written on it, so wanted to try it for himself. His friend, Andy Pem, volunteered to send him a recipe in the post but only included Markaposs name, and apossomewhere in the Yorkshire Dalesapos, alongside a description of him. A post-master contacted Mark after recognising his description, but he refused to share his proper address - and amazingly the letter turned up a few days later. What do you think of Royal Mail  Let us know in the comments... Taking to Facebook, Mark wrote: So, last week, I had a bit of a winge on my timeline, that the BBC were doing a big news story about how a letter got delivered with no real address.I said how Iaposd had one, years ago. Anyway, a friend, on that thread, said heaposd try it, and sent me a letter.  The letter posted to Mark was addressed: Chef Mark Dale, somewhere in the Yorkshire Dales, likes x Pajeroaposs, curly Haired lad, some top hotel chef. Mark said a postmaster saw the thread on Facebook and commented, asking for his address - but he refused. Mark continued: On that thread, a lady commented that she was from Royal Mail and they had it, could I send an address.  I said well, youaposre  per cent there, finding me, so to get my address should be easy now. And today, it arrived special delivery!Meanwhile, a man recently shared his amazement after a letter arrived at his home with a description of who he was, rather than an address.Musician Feargan Lynn had a surprise when a thin white letter popped through the letterbox with ten lines of text rather than the usual address.  Sharing the hilarious moment on Twitter, Feargal gave Royal Mail a shout out, congratulating the mail deliverer for tracking him down.“Hearty applause to @RoyalMail Cushendall and Ballymena for being able to deliver this letter to me today got a much needed laugh!” he wrote. “They had a first name, the village where I grew up and half the postcode.. the rest is more like my le story!”Do you have a story to share  Weaposd love to hear all about it. news uk-news prince-andrew-in-tears-queen-"Prince Andrew stripped of military titles and royal patronagesBySean Rayment:,  Jan Updated:,  Jan Prince Andrew was left ­tearful after being told by the Queen he was being stripped of his honorary military titles, it was claimed tonight.The Duke of York was said to be utterly devastated by his mother’s bombshell decision. It came just a fortnight after the Sunday People exclusively revealed Her Majesty would reluctantly strip her son of his prized roleshe did not resign. However Andrew, , did not bite the bullet – and will now have to write grovelling letters to his former ­regiments, it is understood. A senior defence source said: “The Prince was tearful when told the news even though he had expected it. He feels that he has let so many people down, not least his mother, during her Platinum Jubilee year.”  Our source said Andrew’s ousting had been greeted by a huge sigh of relief from armed forces top brass, who described him as “a bloody embarrassment”. The move came after a US judge ruled a civil case in New York against Andrew by his sex accuser Virginia Giuffre can go ahead. Andrew strenously denies any wrongdoing. Our insider said of the royal’s ­dramatic demotion: “He had hoped that he might get some sort of stay of execution and be allowed to clear his name before his titles were removed. “There are a number of people in the royal household who are utterly convinced that he is innocent. “But the clamour for Andrew’s scalp meant that a quick and brutal decision needed to be made.” The move, announced in a shock Palace statement on Thursday, left Andrew exiled from official royal le and facing le as a private citizen.  He was also told he will no longer be able to use the title of His Royal Highness in any official capacity. The move came after years of damaging speculation arising from Ms Giuffre’s claim she was forced to have sex with the duke three times when she was , including once in London. Andrew’s plight worsened when his former friend Ghislaine Maxwell, , was found guilty of offences relating to her work as fixer for the late billionaire paedophile Jeffrey Epstein, another Andrew associate. One senior defence source said: “Andrew is a victim of very poor decision-making. There is no way he could continue as the honorary head of distinguished military regiments. “His departure has been greeted with a huge sigh of relief. He had become a bloody embarrassment.  “He could not be present at parades, visit units or welcome troops home from operations because the story would always be about sex scandals and not about the regiments.” The duke, who had a -year active career in the Royal Navy and served as a helicopter pilot in the  Falklands war, held the honorary rank of Colonel of the Grenadier Guards. He was also Colonel-in-chief of the  th Royal Lancers, the Royal Irish Regiment, the Yorkshire Regiment, the Small Arms School Corps, and Royal Colonel of the Royal Highland Fusiliers. Plus he was Honorary Air Commodore of RAF Lossiemouth and Commodore-in-Chief of the Fleet Air Arm. Our source said Andrew is to write to each of the regiments expressing his sorrow at having to leave. “He fully maintains his innocence, but wants to apologise for the ­dficulties caused by what has happened,” the insider added. The Duke has also lost a number of overseas honorary military titles.  He was Colonel-in-Chief of the Queen’s York Rangers , the Royal Highland Fusiliers of Canada, the Princess Louise Fusiliersand Colonel-in-Chief of the Royal New Zealand Army Logistic Regiment. The defence source continued: “The big question now is who is going to fill these roles. “They all need to be filled by senior royals which means Prince Charles, who is extremely busy, Princess Anne who already has  military titles, Prince Edward or Prince William. “Honorary titles are hugely important. The role of Captain General of the Royal Marines was held by Prince Philip for  years. He knew the Royal Marines intimately. “When he handed that role over to Prince Harry his parting words were apparently ‘don’t mess it up’ because it meant so much to him.” But the Queen was reluctantly forced to strip Harry, , of the role because he chose to step down from royal duties when he moved to America with we Meghan. Today Andrew and ex-we Sarah Ferguson, , emerged in public together for the first time since he lost his honorary titles. The couple, who orced in  but remain close, looked sombre as Andrew drove them from his Royal Lodge home in Windsor Great Park. There have also been calls for Andrew to be stripped of his Duke of York title. Andrew took the name, traditionally granted to the monarch’s second son, on his marriage to Sarah in . She is still the Duchess of York. Andrew, whose helicopter acted as a decoy for Argentinian cruise missiles during the Falklands war, will also keep his Royal Navy rank of vice-admiral. title: prince andrew keep royal title
story: Prince Andrew may keep royal title despite losing military rank, expert claimsCraig Prescott, a lecturer in law at Bangor University in Wales, has shared his view on Prince Andrews current situation and how he may retain his royal titleAll of Prince Andrews military affiliations and Royal patronages have been ed to The Queen Image: REUTERSByJohn BettAudience Writer:,  Jan Updated:,  Jan Prince Andrew may keep his royal title despite losing his military rank - due to a little known law that dates back to , an expert has claimed. As the sexual abuse lawsuit against the prince develops, Buckingham Palace has issued a statement that says he will lose his remaining patronages and military titles, and he will no longer use His Royal Highness. Initially, in  after that car crash Newsnight interview with Emily Maitlis, Prince Andrewaposs duties were suspended for the foreseeable future, but now the palace has decided to remove his titles altogether, as Hull Live reports. But thanks to a law passed by King George V in , known as Letters Patent, Prince Andrew, like Prince Harry, is entitled to use the style aposHis Royal Highnessapos, unless The Queen officially revokes it - which hasnapost yet happened.For more of the news you care about, straight to your inbox, sign up for one of our daily newslettershere. Dr Prescott said: That Prince Andrew will neverto public le is implicit in the palace’s statement, as all patronages and military positions will revert back to the Queen. Given the Queen’s age, she will likely redistribute them to other members of the royal family. This decision is similar to the one reached with Prince Harry and the Duchess of Sussex in , when they stepped back from their roles as senior royals. Then, the Queen announced that her grandson and his we would no longer use the HRH title. Andrew is now in the same position, though for quite dferent reasons. Formally, all three retain the HRH title, but will not use it in official capacity.  The dficulty for the Queen is that both Prince Harry and Prince Andrew are entitled to retain the title under Letters Patent issued by George V in  - this is a legal document that effectively expresses the wishes of the monarch. King George V wanted a aposslimmed down monarchyapos, so issued a new law - Letters Patent. This limited the number of royal relatives that could use the title of Prince or Princess. This means that only the children and grandchildren of the monarch through the male line are automatically given the title, plus the first son of the eldest son of the Prince of Wales.  Dr Prescott continued: It would take a further Letters Patent for a HRH title to be removed from someone. In  this happened with Diana, Princess of Wales, following her orce with Prince Charles. This was enormously controversial at the time, but it shows that it is possible for someone to formally lose their HRH title. Still, Andrew has not lost everything. He retains the title of aposprinceapos from birth and remains the Duke of York, which is a peerage. Under the law, both titles and peerages are forms of intangible property . A general principle of law is that property cannot simply be seized from someone without prior legal authorisation. He also remains in the line of succession for the throne.  Looking to the future, when Andrew dies, the dukedom will die with him, as he leaves no male heir. Traditionally, the peerage would go to the second eldest son of the monarch . Andrew also retains the position of Councillor of State. Should the Queen be unable to fulfil her formal legal duties due to illness, Councillors of State can fulfil those duties on her behalf. This is provided for by the Regency Acts  to , which specy that the first four in the line of succession of full age , are appointed as Councillors. That currently means Prince Charles, Prince William, Prince Harry and Prince Andrew. Two are expected to act together, whichrequired, would be Prince Charles and Prince William. Again, for this to change, an act of parliament would be required.There are other problems with the Regency Acts, making reform more likely in the near future, especially when Prince Charles becomes King. This would create the opportunity to more thoroughly address the position of both Prince Harry and Prince Andrew.The dukedom and Andrew’s position as a Councillor of State mean that the separation of Prince Andrew from royal le is not entirely complete, but it is as far as the Queen can go for now. The rest is up to Parliament.Do you have a story to share  Weaposd love to hear all about it. news uk-news prince-andrew-would-scream-maids-"Prince Andrew stripped of military titles and royal patronagesByRyan FaheyNews Reporter:,  Jan Prince Andrew would fly into a tantrum and shout and screamhis teddy bear collection was knocked out of place by royal servants, a former royal cop claims.Ex-protection officer Paul Page revealed a heap of intimate anecdotes about the Queenaposs second son in an interview with Ranvir Singh for ITVaposs Ghislaine, Prince Andrew and the Paedophile.Page worked in Royalty and Specialist Protection Command between  and  and had access to the princeaposs private quarters. In this apartment, the Duke of York had a bed piled high with stuffed animals and toys, Page claims. He said: “It had about  or  stuffed toys positioned on the bed and basically there was a card the inspector showed us in a drawer and it was a picture of these bears all in situ. “The reason for the laminated picture wasthose bears weren’t put back in the right order by the maids, he would shout and scream.” One royal writer was introduced to the strange collection at Buckingham Palace in .  Elizabeth Day said of the bizarre meeting: It seemed rather strange that a grown man should be so amused by a stuffed toy.” The new show - Ghislaine, Prince Andrew and the Paedophile - is being aired on ITV on Tuesday at pm. In the programme, ITV says Singh unravels the story of how an entitled daughter of a billionaire sank into shame and disgrace through her friendship with paedophile Jeffrey Epstein. It will also explore how Prince Andrew, the Queenaposs second son, is now embroiled in the scandal as he faces his own possible civil court case brought by Virginia Giuffre Andrew has strenuously denied the allegations made by Ms Giuffre against him.  Page also recalled suspecting that Andrew and pimp Ghislaine were lovers because she would come and go from his quarters at will.Page, who is not without scandal himself after being jailed for a £million fraud scam in , said Ghislaine and Andrewaposs other female friends rarely signed in, The Sun Online reports.Again, speaking with Singh, Page said: “From the way she was allowed to enter and exit the palace at will, we suspected that she may have had an intimate relationship with Prince Andrew.”  He continued: “She kept coming in and out, in and out.” It comes after reports claimed Prince Andrew was tearful when the Queen told him she was stripping him of his honorary military titles. The Duke of York was said to be utterly devastated by his mother’s bombshell decision. The move came after a US judge ruled a civil case in New York against Andrew by his sex accuser Ms Giuffre can go ahead. Andrew strenuously denies any wrongdoing. The princeaposs lawyers want to quiz Ms Giuffreaposs psychologist to seehis accuser is suffering from  memories of meeting him.  It was quickly ridiculed by legal experts who described it as a “typical tactic” used in historic sexual abuse cases, and one Ghislaine Maxwell used at her trial. But Andrew’s lawyers are determined to grill Ms Giuffre’s therapist Dr Judith Lightfoot on the “theory of  memories” as well as matters discussed during their sessions, notes taken and any prescriptions given. The lawyers state that the royal “contends that [Ms Giuffre] may suffer from  memories, as evidenced by the fact that her claims regarding her time with Epstein, and the circumstances under which [Prince Andrew] allegedly assaulted her, have repeatedly changed over the years”.Follow MirrorFacebookTwitterMORE ON Prince Andrew, Duke of YorkITVBuckingham PalaceDocumentariesRoyal FamilyToysGhislaine MaxwellJeffrey Epstein" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get our daily royal round-up direct to your inboxInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: prince harry offered pay security
story: Prince Harry offered to pay for his own security while in the UK but was refusedPrince Harry has threatened the Home Office with pursuing a judicial reviewhe and his family arent provided full and continued security while visiting the UK. It comes after his petition to self-fund his personal protection was "dismissed", his lawyers claimPrince Harry has offered to pay for his own security while in the UK, according to his lawyersBySophie Wingate, PARyan FaheyNews Reporter:,  Jan | commentsPrince Harryaposs offer to pay for his own police protection while in the UK was dismissed by the Home Office, his lawyers claim.The Duke of Sussex has threatened to pursue a judicial review against a decision made by the Home Officethe Government does not provide continued security while he and his family are in the country.In a statement, the duke also made clear he is happy to pay for officers - an offer which has been dismissed, according to a Mail on Sunday investigation.In a statement from the Princeaposs lawyers, he insists on the self-funded protection so his family does not impose on the British taxpayer. He first offered to pay for his own security detail in January  at Sandringham. But this current legal action, which began in September last year, stems from his July  visit to the UK for the unveiling of a statue of his late mum, Princess Diana.While the prince was not provided security on this occasion, he was protected just months earlier when he visited to attend the funeral of his granddad, Prince Philip.  In a statement from Harryaposs lawyers, he claims the lack of continuity means the prince and his family are unable tohome. And his simple goal is to ensure the safety of his kids so they can know his home country.The statement adds: The UK will always be Prince Harry ’s home and a country he wants his we and children to be safe in.With the lack of police protection, comes too great a personal risk. The prince also hopes his petition for the review - and after pleading with the Home Office for security - will resolve this situation.  The statement also gives further detail of the nature of Harryaposs inherited security risk, which he carries for le. He remains sixth in line to the throne, served two tours of combat duty in Afghanistan, and in recent years his family has been subjected to well-documented neo-Nazi and extremist threats, it says. While his role within the institution has changed, his profile as a member of the Royal Family has not. Nor has the threat to him and his family.  Through his lawyers, the prince also pointed to other high-profile figures with an inherent threat risk who receive free police protection after leaving public office. Responding to the news of Harryaposs case, a Government spokesperson said: “The UK Government’s protective security system is rigorous and proportionate. It is our long-standing policy not to provide detailed information on those arrangements. To do so could compromise their integrity and affect iniduals’ security. “It would also not be appropriate to comment on the detail of any legal proceedings.”  A judicial review is a type of court case in which a claimant challenges the lawfulness of a decision made by a public body or government department, such as the Home Office, according to the Judiciary UK website. A judge reviews the way in which a decision has been made. The court is not really concerned with the conclusions of that process and whether they were right or wrong, as long as the right procedures have been followed. The court will not re-make the decision. If the claimant wins, the decision can be declared unlawful, or quashed. That will usually mean the decision has to be taken again. While the public body could reach the same decision again, it may follow a proper procedure that leads to a dferent decision result. news uk-news prince-harry-says-lack-security-"Prince Harry files claim over police protection for familyByDave BurkeSenior News Reporter:,  Jan Updated:,  Jan | commentsPrince Harry says he is unable to bring we Meghan and their two children to the UK due to a lack of security.The -year-old, who remains sixth in line to the throne despite quitting royal duties in , has threatened legal action against the Home Office.He is said to be keen to bring son Archie and daughter Lilibet to visit his homeland, but claims he is unable to do so. Megan and Archie have not ed to the UK since the couple walked away from royal le in , while Lilibet has yet to set foot in the country where her dad was born. Lawyers acting for the Duke of Sussex say they will seek a judicial reviewcontinued security is not provided when he and his family visit. In a statement his legal team said Harryaposs security was compromised last summer when he unveiled a statue of his mother, Princess Diana, at Kensington Palace. It said that Harry - who inherited a security threat at birth - is unable toto his home with his family, saying they have been subjected to well-documented neo-Nazi and extremist threats. Without police protection, lawyers said, bringing Meghan and the children over comes at too great a personal risk. The Duke has ed to the UK twice in the last two years - for the statue unveiling in July last year and Prince Philipaposs funeral three months earlier - but Meghan and the children have stayed in the US both times. Harry is arguing his private protection team in the US does not have adequate jurisdiction abroad or access to UK intelligence information which is needed keep the Sussex family safe.  The UK will always be Prince Harryaposs home and a country he wants his we and children to be safe in, the statement said. The Duke has filed a claim for a judicial review against a Home Office decision not to allow him to personally pay for police protection while in the UK. His representatives said British taxpayers will not have to foot the bill, but said a private security team cannot replicate the protection needed.  It added that he had first offered to pay for police protection for himself and his family in January , but the offer was not accepted. During last summeraposs visit to London, Harryaposs car was chased by photographers - an incident that has made him anxious about his safety. A source told the Mail on Sunday: aposHarryaposs argument in a nutshell is: aposYou got the law wrong.apos He feels the decision to remove his security was wrong. Pre-action protocol was sent by Harryaposs lawyers to the Home Office a couple of months ago. This is essentially a precursor to a judicial review. If the case goes forward it could lead to a legal battle in the High Court between Government ministers and the Duke.  The statement in full Prince Harry inherited a security risk at birth, for le. He remains sixth in line to the throne, served two tours of combat duty in Afghanistan, and in recent years his family has been subjected to well-documented neo-Nazi and extremist threats. While his role within the institution has changed, his profile as a member of the royal family has not. Nor has the threat to him and his family.The Duke and Duchess of Sussex personally fund a private security team for their family, yet that security cannot replicate the necessary police protection needed whilst in the UK. In the absence of such protection, Prince Harry and his family are unable toto his home.The duke first offered to pay personally for UK police protection for himself and his family in January of  at Sandringham. That offer was dismissed. He remains willing to cover the cost of security, as not to impose on the British taxpayer. As is widely known, others who have left public office and have an inherent threat risk receive police protection at no cost to them. The goal for Prince Harry has been simple - to ensure the safety of himself and his family while in the UK so his children can know his home country.  During his last visit to the UK in July  - to unveil a statue in honour of his late mother - his security was compromised due to the absence of police protection, whilst leaving a charity event. After another attempt at negotiations was also rejected, he sought a judicial review in September  to challenge the decision-making behind the security procedures, in the hopes that this could be re-evaluated for the obvious and necessary protection required. The UK will always be Prince Harryaposs home and a country he wants his we and children to be safe in. With the lack of police protection, comes too great a personal risk. Prince Harry hopes that his petition - after close to two years of pleas for security in the UK - will resolve this situation. It is due to a leak in a UK tabloid, with surreptitious timing, we feel it necessary to release a statement setting the facts straight. news uk-news prince-harrys-security-legal-squabble-"Prince Harry files claim over police protection for familyopinionByRussell MyersRoyal Editor:,  Jan Updated:,  Jan | commentsOf all the tantrums over tiaras and titles, this latest squabble really is quite unique. The Duke of Sussex’s unprecedented move of threatening to sue the government is both breathtaking and utterly baffling. Those in royal circles have almost universally questioned the play at hand, not only in its nature but equally in execution. True enough, with his background in the military and his position in one of the most famous families in the world – and celebrity lestyle – Prince Harry and his family are arguably high profile targets.  But to suggest he is at a greater risk at home than abroad, where he has chosen to base himself, surely holds very little weight. Indeed the manner of this row seems even more bizarre that it is still being argued two years on from being granted his wish to up and leave his royal role, on the understanding that you can’t have everything you want. This is all before even considering the effect on the Queen, who we are told has been made aware of her grandson’s latest bright idea just as she emerges from one of her most tumultuous periods of recent years. She faced her first Christmas without her beloved husband before wielding the axe on her son Prince Andrew’s royal career.What do you think  Have your say in our comments below... The decision to banish him into the wilderness, arguably a couple of years behind schedule, would not have come easy no matter the depths of his fall from grace. Now, just three weeks away from the beginning of her Platinum Jubilee year, Her Majesty is facing down another petulant member of her family for reasons she would be forgiven for assuming had been sorted. Keep up to date with all the latest news from the Queen, Charles, William, Kate, Harry, Meghan, George, Charlotte, Louis, Archie and the rest of the family. Weaposll send the best Royal news directly to your inbox so you never have to miss a thing.to our newsletter here. At every turn the Queen has handled Harry’s behaviour with good grace, wishing him well and extending a loving sentiment that he and his family would always be much loved members of her own. With the season of goodwill to all now behind us, one may wonder how much is left. news uk-news scientists-list-new-omicron-symptoms-"What are the symptoms of the Omicron Variant of Covid ByAaliyah RuggGraeme Murray:,  Jan Updated:,  Jan  As new iants of Covid emerge during the panic, people can easily become confused whether they have Omicron or simply a common cold. Three main symptoms of coronavirus are listed by the NHS as a high temperature, a new, continuous cough and a loss or change to your sense of smell and taste.But scientists behind the ZOE Covid symptom app claim others testing positive for Omicron are now reporting symptoms more like a common cold. Scientists took health reports from contributors reporting positive cases in the ZOE COVID Study app in December  as Omicron became dominant They then compared them with data from early October when Delta was the dominant iant. The Liverpool Echo reports Dr Claire Steves found the top five symptoms in both periods were: Runny nose Headache Fatigue Sneezing Sore throatThe analysis found no clear dference in the symptom profile of Delta and Omicron, with only % of people experiencing the classic three symptoms of fever, cough, or loss of sense of smell or taste. The typical symptoms of a cough, loss of taste and smell and fever, were further down on the list. Other symptoms in order included:Persistent cough Hoarse voice Other Shivers Fever Dizzy Brain fog Altered smell Eye sorenessUnusual muscle pains Skipped meals Loss of smell Chest pains Swollen glands Feeling downLoss of smell and taste become much less common. It was in the top  symptoms earlier in , and now itaposs ranking at , with only one in five people experiencing it. Dr Steves said cold-like symptoms remain the top symptoms in people with covid and classic symptoms such as a cough are much less prevalent. She added: Most reported symptoms are really very much like a cold, especially in people who have been vaccinated. If you are feeling at all under the weather please make sure you get a test. If the symptoms are mild, why should I worry about Omicron Omicron can still hospitalise and cause serious illness and can spread much quicker, scientists say, as well as having damaging effects on the economy due to high numbers of people needing to self-isolate. According to ZOE research, findings show exactly what you can do to strengthen your immune system — like eating a healthy - and to help protect yourself against coronavirus and other harmful invaders. In detail, the study found that people who ate a high-quality diet, rich in plant-based foods, were  per cent less likely to get Covid- and  per cent less likely to get severe illness requiring treatment in the hospital.Additionally, being fully vaccinated has been found to be the best way to protect people from severe disease and hospitalisation as well as mask wearing in crowded places. news uk-news six-times-prince-andrew-tried-"Prince Andrew addresses Virginia Giuffre’s allegations in ByDave BurkeSenior News Reporter:,  Jan Updated:,  Jan Prince Andrew may finally have to answer key questions in the coming months over the sex abuse allegations which have seen him cast out into the cold. This week it was announced that the Queen had revoked his honorary military titles and can no longer use the title His Royal Highness. It comes after a US judged threw out his latest attempt to have a civil case brought by Virginia Giuffre thrown out. Ms Giuffre, now , claims that she was forced to have sex with the Duke three times when she was a apossex slaveapos of Andrewaposs paedophile pal Jeffrey Epstein as a teenager. The Duke of York vehemently denies the allegations. In recent weeks his legal team have tried numerous times to get the case thrown out, or to discredit Ms Giuffre, who they have claimed is seeking another payday at his expense.  Ms Giuffreaposs legal representative said his client is determined to face the royal in court after judge Lewis Kaplan said her civil case can proceed. The mum-of-three is seeking undisclosed damages from Andrew, who she was pictured with in an infamous photograph believed to have been taken in , when she was . It means Andrew could be compelled to answer questions about her claims in a civil court in the autumn. Here we look at some of the attempts the Duke and his team have made to prevent the court showdown from happening. . Claiming Virginia Giuffre may have  memoriesAs the Sunday Mirror reports today, Andrew’s lawyers want to quiz Ms Giuffre’s psychologist to seehis accuser is ­suffering from “ memories” of meeting HIM.The extraordinary move emerged in legal documents filed late on Friday in the Duke of York’s looming civil court battle with Ms Giuffre. But he claims he doesn’t remember meeting her – despite the infamous photo of him with his arm around her. It was quickly ridiculed by legal experts who described it as a “typical tactic” used in historic sexual abuse cases, and one Ghislaine Maxwell used at her trial.  But Andrew’s lawyers are determined to grill Ms Giuffre’s therapist Dr Judith Lightfoot on the “theory of  memories” as well as matters discussed during their sessions, notes taken and any prescriptions given. The lawyers state that the royal “contends that [Ms Giuffre] may suffer from  memories, as evidenced by the fact that her claims regarding her time with Epstein, and the circumstances under which [Prince Andrew] allegedly assaulted her, have repeatedly changed over the years”. The move bizarrely links to the Duke of York’s stance in his  car crash Newsnight interview where he claimed to have “no recollection” of meeting Ms Giuffre.. Attempting to rely on secret deal made with paedophile Jeffrey Epstein One avenue Andrewaposs legal team used to try and get the case thrown out was a , settlement made between Ms Giuffre and his former pal Epstein. In a  deal which was unsealed earlier this year, the financier and child trafficker agreed to pay Ms Giuffre after she accused him of sexual abuse. One key clause in the deal suggested that Ms Giuffre would be barred from taking action against any other parties linked to Epstein.  This, the Dukeaposs lawyers argued, would have included Andrew himself. The settlement included an agreement to remise, release, acquit, satisfy and forever discharge the said second parties and any other person or entity who could have been included as a potential defendant … from all, and all manner of, action and actions of Virginia , including state or federal, cause and causes of action”. But Judge Kaplan was having none of it. Epstein, he said, was only out to protect himself, he ruled, and this aspect of the agreement did not prevent Ms Giuffre from pursuing a civil claim against Andrew. Judge Kaplan said that settlement was too ambiguous to protect the royal. . Arguing Ms Giuffre could not sue as she lived in Australia Another technicality which Andrewaposs team hoped could prevent the case continuing was the fact that Ms Giuffre no longer lives in the US. This, lawyers claimed, meant that she could not legally take action through a US court.  The Dukeaposs lawyer Andrew B Brettler, called for the case to be halted at the end of last month. He wrote: “Recently discovered evidence suggests that the court does not have subject matter jurisdiction over this action because plaintf Virginia L Giuffre cannot satisfy the elements of ersity jurisdiction. “Notwithstanding that, in her complaint Ms Giuffre alleges she is a citizen of the state of Colorado the evidence demonstrates that she is actually domiciled in Australia, where she has lived for all but two of the past  years.” Again, this legal argument did not get very far. . aposHidingapos to prevent lawsuit being served on himBack when the civil case was launched, Andrew was accused of hiding to avoid the lawsuit being served on him.Security personnel repeatedly stopped officials trying to hand the Duke of York the documents at the Royal Lodge in August, it was claimed. Ms Giuffreaposs lawyers said the papers had been handed to a Met Police officer at the Royal Lodge in Windsor on August . But they claimed the agent was told police told them they were not able to accept served court papers, or let anyone serve them on the property. It led to Ms Giuffreaposs lawyers seeking intervention from Judge Kaplan, claiming Prince Andrew was playing game of hide and seek behind palace walls.  . Claiming not have met Ms GiuffreDuring his car-crash BBC Panorama interview back in , Andrew claimed he had no recollection of ever meeting Ms Giuffre.Rubbishing her allegations that she had been forced into having sex with him, Andrew said: I have no recollection of ever meeting this lady. None, whatsoever. He was pressed by interviewer Emily Maitlis, who asked him: You donapost remember meeting her  The Duke replied: No. Years earlier a photo had emerged of Andrew with his arms around Ms Giuffre with Ghislaine Maxwell in the background. However his circle have long suggested it is a fake - alleging that his fingers were not chubby enough to be his in the image. A palace source said Andrew has “absolutely no recollection” of the photo being taken and “seriously doubts” it is genuine. “Look at his fingers,” they said. “The duke has chubby fingers, they don’t look right, nor does the height of the duke and the girl. His legal team have asked to have the original photo so they can carry out their own investigation. They seriously doubt its veracity. The duke is adamant and has been consistent since  that he does not recall ever meeting Miss Roberts, let alone the photo being taken.” “Many close to the duke, who know him well, believe this is a witch-hunt based on absolutely no evidence.” . Pizza Express alibi and claims he could not sweat  Two of the claims in Andrewaposs  Panorama interview that drew the most attention were his claim that he was at a Pizza Express restaurant on one of the nights he is claimed to have had sex with Ms Giuffre - and his claim he cannot sweat. Quizzed about Ms Giuffreaposs claim that the prince sweated heavily on the night in , Andrew claimed to have a medical condition that meant he could not sweat. In legal documents related to the civil case, Ms Giuffreaposs lawyers David Boies and Sigrid McCawley called on the Duke to hand over all documents concerning your alleged medical condition of anhidrosis, hypohidrosis, or your inability to sweat. His lawyers refused, however, on the grounds that it is harassing and seeks confidential and private information and documents that are irrelevant, immaterial and not reasonably calculated to lead to the discovery of admissible evidence. Similarly the Duke has not presented any evidence proving he was at Pizza Express on March ,  - the night Ms Giuffre claims he partied in a West End nightclub before having sex with her. His lawyers responded: “Defendant is unable to comply with Request No.  because no such documents exist in his possession, custody or control. A diligent search and a reasonable inquiry have been made in an effort to comply with this demand.”Follow MirrorFacebookTwitterMORE ON Prince Andrew, Duke of YorkRoyal Family" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get our daily royal round-up direct to your inboxInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: sniffing your milk instead using
story: Snfing your milk instead of using best-before dates can cut m pints of food wasteMore than  million pints are tipped down the sink each year because of overly cautious dates - it is the third most wasted item in the UKGiving your milk a snf can tell youits gone off Image: Getty ImagesopinionByNada FarhoudEnvironment editor:,  Jan | commentsHow many times have you opened the fridge to find your milk has passed the use-by date but is perfectly fine to drink  Giving it a good snf normally tells youit has turned sour, but more than  million pints are ­unnecessarily tipped down the sink each year because of overly cautious dates. Research by the University of Chester also found milk from Tesco, Sainsbury’s, Asda and Morrisons, kept unopened in a fridge set at C, remained safe to drink days after its use-by date. Now, in a victory for the environment and common sense, Morrisons says use-by dates on its milk cartons are to become a thing of the past. At the end of the month, the ­supermarket will instead be printing best-before dates on dairy products and encouraging people to do a “snf test”.  It comes as figures revealed that milk is the third most wasted food and drink item in the UK, with more than half a million tons of dairy chucked every year, most of that in the home. Nearly % of us are still confused by best-before and use-by dates. As supermarket foods carry wildly dferent information on how long they will last – some by as much as five months for the same items – it is not dficult to see why. Take a look through your kitchen cupboards and you will find “once-opened” instructions on similar items that are inconsistent and unclear as to whether they are recommendations on food safety or quality. The use-by date is about safety and the most important thing to remember. Foods can be eatenup until the use-by date but not after. Best before refers to the quality and taste. The food is most likely safe to eat after this date but may not be at its best in terms of flavour and texture. You can’t beat looking, smelling and tasting for a reliable indicator of how fresh the food is. But it would be even better for ­supermarkets and manufacturers to come up with a standard labelling system that was clear, consistent and easy to understand – to stop any more perfectly edible food ending up in the bin. title: tower block residents endure bitter
story: Tower block residents endure bitter conditions after cladding removed and not replacedAfter living in fear for years following the Grenfell Tower fire, the type of flammable cladding which caused the lethal inferno in London was finally removed from the apartment blocksEithne and Martin Crowson of Holm Court and Plane Court in Pendleton, Salford Image: MEN MediaByJosie Le VayGraeme Murray:,  Jan | commentsHundreds of people claim they are living in bitter conditions in freezing high rise flats. Residents say the nine blocks look half-built and the windows protrude with numbers which are written in paint outside fats.And after more than four years on from the Grenfell fire in London, occupants have yet to see any replacement cladding.The blocks are can be seen from all over Salford, Manchester, but residents say the real nightmare lies inside their walls.. Lynne Broughton has lived in Thorn Court for  years. and only in the last few years she has wanted to leave.Itaposs cold, no matter how much you put the heating on itaposs freezing. I have to put blankets around my legs. I was dreading this Christmas. We have get through another winter, she told Manchester Evening News. After living in fear for years following Grenfell, the type of flammable cladding which caused the lethal inferno was finally removed from the apartment blocks in Salford in September .  The residents may no longer be living in fear of fire - but now theyaposre living in fear of the cold and the meter. This is because the buildingaposs heating system depends on the cladding to retain heat. Without it, draughts whip through the flats, which have around  residents, at a time when the cost of energy is rocketing. Before, when Iaposd switch the heating on, in half-an-hour it would be as warm as toast, Lynne said. Now, she says as soon as she walks into her flat apositaposs like being outsideapos, even though she always puts the heating on. Lynneaposs bought thick curtains, keeps her blinds down, and has put bubble wrap below her windows to try and stop the draught. But the cold isnapost the only issue caused by the cladding being removed. Many of the residents have water coming in through their exposed windows too. Ours is p***ing with rain and itaposs freezing, Lynne said of her flat. Iaposd say the majority of the block, Iaposd say itaposs the cold and the draughts and the water, she said.  If there was plenty of houses I think I would have moved out. Itaposs two years down now. Weaposre still in the cold. Whoaposs to say weaposll get the cladding later this year  They should have never have done what they did. If you donapost live in these blocks you donapost know what itaposs like. They donapost give a s**t, weaposre the poor people. Residents had previously been told that the cladding would be replaced by . Pendleton Together has now said that works are set to be complete by  - a whole two years behind schedule. Not everyone can afford the extra money thataposs needed to heat their homes. The Manchester Evening News spoke to one single mum-of-three, who doesnapost want to be named, who says she hasnapost turned her heating on for aposwell over a yearapos. She said: I donapost put the heating on at all. I sit in blankets and make the kids wrap up. I canapost afford it.  She has a newborn baby, a three-year-old and a five-year-old and wants to get out - to a flat with more than two bedrooms - and to somewhere she can afford to heat. Iaposm a single parent, where am I going to get the money to go private  she said. Instead, she survives day-by-day by spending as little time in her flat as possible. She leaves the house at am in the morning and makes her way to the warmth of her mumaposs house and doesnapostuntil itaposs time to take her children to bed. Rachel, who lives at the top of Thorn Court, says she doesnapost use her living room anymore, and has to watch TV in bed. Itaposs cold like outside. You spend most of your time in your bedroom because itaposs the warmest place, but Iaposd like to sit in the living room and chill out. It used to be dead warm but now itaposs freezing cold. You just have to put blankets on and keep the curtains shut and stuff like that, she said. Hundreds of residents across the nine blocks of flats are taking legal action against Pendleton Together, the Private Finance Initiative contractor which manages the council properties. They are claiming the properties are aposunfit for human habitationapos - mostly down to the cold. Martin Eithne and Martin Crowson are two of them. The retired couple live in Holm Court and chair the blockaposs residents association. They say that they were paying £ a week in electricity bills when the cladding was on. Now, they say theyaposre paying £.  Itaposs down to them to pay us back, Eithne said. Martin says that the biggest issue people are facing in his block is that the electric is aposcosting a fortuneapos. If you put your heating on it costs a fortune, around £ a day extra, he said. Thereaposs people that stay in bed earlier and get out of bed later because of the cladding. They canapost put the heat on because they canapost afford they canapost afford to put the heating on. Pendleton Together is giving the residents £ every two months during the winter. But everyone the M.E.N. spoke to said it was not enough. Robert Vaudrey lives in Holm Court with his we Pamela and their four-year-old daughter April. We moved in with the baby, it was our first home together, he said. The biggest problem is the heating. Since the cladding got removed, weaposre putting in £ a week.  He says the aposgesture amountsapos of money heaposs been given arenapost enough - and aposdonapost even cover a monthaposs worthapos. The payments arenapost even touching the sides, he said. Weaposve got a littlaposun. Keeping a four-year-old dressed, trying to explain that itaposs cold, itaposs just ridiculous. The heating costs so much that Pamela had the idea of covering the thermostat up with a flannel. Itaposs so the computer thinks itaposs warmer than it is. Weaposve set it to  degrees, once it goes below it takes a daft amount of money from us, Robert said. The heating may be a winter issue - but it affects the family during the summer months as well. It costs an awful lots of money, money we save up for during the summer. We have to save up. During the summer weaposve got no money to spend, Robert said. Matthew Condrad, the director of Tenant Claim, says that aposall nine of the flats have got the same issuesapos. He claims there are around  people living in the Pendleton flats - and  of them have gone to him for legal help. He said: The buildings are fitted with NIBE heating system which operates at a low temperature and relies upon the cladding to retain heat. Removal of the cladding has therefore caused excess cold which has been exacerbated by draughts around windows and ventilation ducts. The windows do not open properly and constitute a hazard. Some have also fallen out. Matthew has put forward some test cases from the Pendleton flats - andsuccessful - others will follow. But he admits that itaposs a process that could take years. And he believes that evenhe wins the case, Pendleton Together will appeal, as aposthereaposs a lot of money at stakeapos. The cladding may even be replaced by the time the cases enter the courtroom. Lynne from Thorn Court is certainly sceptical. She fears that as she accepted the apostokenapos amount of money from Pendleton Together her case would fail. She also points out, thatthe case ends up taking five years to settle, lots of the elderly claimants aposwill have carked it by A spokesperson from Pendleton Together said: Pendleton Together understands that our residents have concerns during the programme of fire safety works and we are working with them to offer support or to direct them towards services that can offer further help. As part of this support Pendleton Together Operating Limitedis providing fairly calculated winter energy payments that mitigate the dference in electricity consumption. This will mean that no resident is left out of pocket due to this dference. that timeapos. We have received reports of water ingress in some of our properties and we have responded to these. All known issues have been or are being addressed, however residents with any new concerns should contact us immediately or book a repair via our website. In relation to the timeframe for replacement of cladding, within days of the tragedy at Grenfell, Pendleton Together and Salford City Council committed to removing all cladding and insulation on our nine blocks and replacing them with safe alternatives. Unfortunately, due to well documented issues around clarity of regulation and ability to secure funding, that affects landlords nationwide, the work has taken longer than anticipated. All of the cladding has now been removed and necessary preparatory works are taking place prior to the reinstatement of cladding which is expected to start on some of our blocks in the next few months. The programme of fire safety works, which includes the replacement of cladding, the installation of sprinklers and heat detectors and other internal mitigation works is set to complete in . We are very sorry for the inconvenience and disruption that our residents are feeling. We have a dedicated team supporting our residents and keeping them informed and are doing our very best to put things in place to mitigate any disturbance. If any resident has any concerns they should contact their Resident Liaison Officer as soon as possible. news uk-news uk-weather-forecast-exact-day-"UK Weather: Met Office forecast frostByAlahna KindredNews Reporter:,  Jan Updated:,  Jan | commentsThe Met Office has issued an update on when snow will hit the UK as freezing temperatures are set to last all week. Temperatures will plunge below zero before Brits see any of the white stuff - which forecasters say will last some regions of the isles on Friday, January .Forecasters see the mercury plunging to lows of -C over the next seven days with the chill remaining in the low single-digits every night and reaching just over the C mark in daylight hours. WXChart meteorologists predict snow will be first seen in Scotland before moving South to northern England, according to The Sun Online. East Anglia is predicted to be hit with wintry showers early on January , before parts of the country between Aberdeen and Hampshire will then see snow on Sunday January .The arctic chill follows the trend of recent days after the Met Office warned of -C conditions amid blanketings of thick icy fog on Friday.During the day, temperatures will be milder hours this week will see milder temperatures, reaching as high as C in the southwest while generally staying around the  or C mark.  But as night approaches the cold will take hold with bone-shaking chills of -C seen in Wales on the coldest night of the week, which looks set to be the early hours of Tuesday morning. The Met Office has also predicted snow for the first half of February. Their long-range forecast reads: Into February outbreaks of rain and stronger winds are likely at times across the far north, whereas settled conditions are likely to persist in the south.  Temperatures are looking to be slightly above average, particularly in the north however some colder interludes remain likely, bringing a risk of occasional snow, most likely over northern hills. Five-day forecast Tonight: Most areas dry with long clear periods and fog patches. Cloudier and windier in the far north with some rain at times. Colder than last night with widespread frost. Monday: A chilly start then most areas fine, dry and bright with plenty of sunshine once early fog patches clear. Cloudier in the very far north with rain at times.  Outlook for Tuesday to Thursday: A cold and foggy start for some on Tuesday, with sunny spells developing. Rain arrives into the northwest later, sinking south but weakening through Wednesday. Thursday, dry with sunny spells.
